author: Socrates
quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

author: Plato
quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.

author: Aristotle
quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.

author: Confucius
quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Laozi
quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

author: Sun Tzu
quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.

author: René Descartes
quote: I think, therefore I am.

author: Immanuel Kant
quote: Act in such a way that you treat humanity, whether in your own person or in the person of any other, never merely as a means to an end, but always at the same time as an end.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman.

author: Albert Camus
quote: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.

author: Voltaire
quote: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.

author: John Locke
quote: No man's knowledge here can go beyond his experience.

author: Thomas Hobbes
quote: The life of man, solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short.

author: Niccolò Machiavelli
quote: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.

author: Baruch Spinoza
quote: The highest activity a human being can attain is learning for understanding, because to understand is to be free.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.

author: Epictetus
quote: We cannot choose our external circumstances, but we can always choose how we respond to them.

author: Seneca
quote: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.

author: Epicurus
quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.

author: Pythagoras
quote: As soon as laws are necessary for men, they are no longer fit for freedom.

author: Heraclitus
quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.

author: Democritus
quote: Nothing exists except atoms and empty space; everything else is opinion.

author: Diogenes
quote: He has the most who is most content with the least.

author: Anaxagoras
quote: The descent to Hades is the same from every place.

author: Parmenides
quote: We can speak and think only of what exists. And what exists is uncreated and imperishable for it is whole and unchanging and complete.

author: Thales of Miletus
quote: The most difficult thing in life is to know yourself.

author: Augustine of Hippo
quote: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.

author: Thomas Aquinas
quote: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.

author: David Hume
quote: A wise man proportions his belief to the evidence.

author: John Stuart Mill
quote: A person may cause evil to others not only by his actions but by his inaction, and in either case he is justly accountable to them for the injury.

author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
quote: The limits of my language mean the limits of my world.

author: Martin Heidegger
quote: Every man is born as many men and dies as a single one.

author: George Berkeley
quote: To be is to be perceived.

author: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz
quote: In whatever manner God created the world, it would always have been regular and in a certain general order.

author: Blaise Pascal
quote: The heart has its reasons of which reason knows nothing.

author: Montesquieu
quote: Useless laws weaken the necessary laws.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
quote: Man is born free and everywhere he is in chains.

author: Adam Smith
quote: The real tragedy of the poor is the poverty of their aspirations.

author: Mary Wollstonecraft
quote: No man chooses evil because it is evil; he only mistakes it for happiness, the good he seeks.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.

author: Jeremy Bentham
quote: The greatest happiness of the greatest number is the foundation of morals and legislation.

author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
quote: We learn from history that we do not learn from history.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone; and if he does not love solitude, he will not love freedom; for it is only when he is alone that he is really free.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: It’s not what you look at that matters, it’s what you see.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.

author: William James
quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes.

author: John Dewey
quote: We do not learn from experience... we learn from reflecting on experience.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.

author: Michel Foucault
quote: I don't feel that it is necessary to know exactly what I am. The main interest in life and work is to become someone else that you were not in the beginning.

author: Noam Chomsky
quote: If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all.

author: Jacques Derrida
quote: The intellectual is someone who is not afraid to point out the emperor's new clothes.

author: Hannah Arendt
quote: The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.

author: Karl Popper
quote: No rational argument will have a rational effect on a man who does not want to adopt a rational attitude.

author: Slavoj Žižek
quote: The problem for us is not are our desires satisfied or not. The problem is how do we know what we desire.

author: Martha Nussbaum
quote: To be a good human being is to have a kind of openness to the world, an ability to trust uncertain things beyond your own control.

author: Peter Singer
quote: If we can prevent something bad without sacrificing anything of comparable significance, we ought to do it.

author: Cornel West
quote: You can't lead the people if you don't love the people. You can't save the people if you don't serve the people.

author: Judith Butler
quote: We lose ourselves in what we read, only to return to ourselves, transformed and part of a more expansive world.

author: Avicenna
quote: The knowledge of anything, since all things have causes, is not acquired or complete unless it is known by its causes.

author: Al-Ghazali
quote: The happiness of the drop is to die in the river.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: He who finds a new path is a pathfinder, even if the trail has to be found again by others; and he who walks far ahead of his contemporaries is a leader, even though centuries pass before he is recognized as such.

author: Rumi
quote: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.

author: Murasaki Shikibu
quote: Even in this world of uncertainty, we are never quite sure what is going to happen.

author: Dogen
quote: If you are unable to find the truth right where you are, where else do you expect to find it?

author: Bankei Yotaku
quote: Don't get attached to the things you're looking at. Start to be aware of the one who is looking.

author: Ryokan
quote: To find the Buddha, you have to see your own nature.

author: Shunryu Suzuki
quote: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's mind there are few.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.

author: Chuang Tzu
quote: The wise man knows that it is better to sit on the banks of a remote mountain stream than to be emperor of the whole world.

author: Mencius
quote: The great man is he who does not lose his child's-heart.

author: Xunzi
quote: The petty man is eager to make boasts, yet desires that others should believe in him.

author: Han Fei
quote: It is dangerous for a ruler to trust others. He who trusts others can be manipulated by others.

author: Mozi
quote: To feel affection for people is the basis of benevolence, and to do away with what harms them is the basis of righteousness.

author: Simone Weil
quote: Attention is the rarest and purest form of generosity.

author: Mary Midgley
quote: The trouble with human beings is not really that they are selfish, but that they are not selfish enough.

author: Philippa Foot
quote: There are no duties to the dead, because death is the end of all duties.

author: Iris Murdoch
quote: We live in a fantasy world, a world of illusion. The great task in life is to find reality.

author: G. E. M. Anscombe
quote: The only events that are truly random are those that are not caused by anything.

author: Hypatia
quote: Reserve your right to think, for even to think wrongly is better than not to think at all.

author: Plotinus
quote: Knowledge, if it does not determine action, is dead to us.

author: Boethius
quote: Nothing is miserable unless you think it so.

author: Anselm of Canterbury
quote: I do not seek to understand that I may believe, but I believe in order to understand.

author: William of Ockham
quote: Entities should not be multiplied without necessity.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Knowledge is power.

author: Gottlob Frege
quote: Every good mathematician is at least half a philosopher, and every good philosopher is at least half a mathematician.

author: Edmund Husserl
quote: Experience by itself is not science.

author: Theodor Adorno
quote: The splinter in your eye is the best magnifying-glass.

author: Walter Benjamin
quote: The storyteller takes what he tells from experience—his own or that reported by others. And he in turn makes it the experience of those who are listening to his tale.

author: Max Horkheimer
quote: The revolution which is to be brought about by the victory of the proletariat is the victory of the human race over the beast of prey.

author: Jürgen Habermas
quote: The public sphere, in contrast to the private, is the sphere of public opinion.

author: Frantz Fanon
quote: For a colonized people the most essential value, because the most concrete, is first and foremost the land: the land which will bring them bread and, above all, dignity.

author: Angela Davis
quote: We have to talk about liberating minds as well as liberating society.

author: bell hooks
quote: What we do is more important than what we say or what we say we believe.

author: Kwame Anthony Appiah
quote: In life, the challenge is not so much to figure out how best to play the game; the challenge is to figure out what game you're playing.

author: Alain Badiou
quote: Love without risk is an impossibility, like war without death.
